title: Agony as police say reports abducted girl Kamille McKinney was found are false
text:
Missing toddler Kamille McKinney was reported to have been found safe and well, only for police to then confirm she is still missing

The family of a missing toddler abducted from a birthday party face further agony after reports the youngster had been found safe and well proved false.

Kamille ‘Cupcake’ McKinney was reported to have been found at an apartment complex at Birmingham, Alabama, on Wednesday morning.

Local Sheriff Mark Pettway, from Jefferson County Sheriff’s Department, initially said that three year-old Kamille had been found safe and well.

But Sgt Johnny Williams, from Birmingham Police Department, has since confirmed those reports were false, and that Kamille is still missing.

Sgt Williams team are leading the investigation into Kamille’s disappearance, and said confusion arose when a bounty hunter mistook another toddler living in the apartment complex for Kamille. A huge crowd gathered and cheered at the news, causing confusion among the sheriff’s department.

Advertisement

Advertisement

Ambulances and police cars were called to the scene, but have since left, with the search of the complex now complete.

To view this video please enable JavaScript, and consider upgrading to a web browser that supports HTML5 video

A fire truck is pictured at the apartment complex where missing toddler Kamille McKinney was falsely reported to have been found alive and well

The youngster was last seen playing outside during a birthday party held close to her apartment block on Saturday night.

Two persons of interest in the toddler’s abduction were arrested on unrelated charges on Tuesday, as police warned Kamille may have been taken out of Alabama.

Eyewitnesses who witnessed Camille’s abduction told police that they saw a man and woman lure Kamille toward a dark SUV with candy.

The man then picked up Kamille, placed her in the car, and drove off, they said.

Officials then issued an Amber Alert and said the couple was ‘enticing children with candy,’ according to WVTM-13.

An ambulance drives away after a false alarm that missing toddler Kamille McKinney had been found

Police later released photos of the SUV and male suspect, who they subsequently located and took into custody on Sunday night.

Advertisement

Advertisement

That suspect is said to live at the same apartment complex at Kamille.

The unidentified man’s girlfriend was also taken into custody, but Kamille has not yet been found, AL.com reported.
description: The family of a missing toddler abducted from a birthday party face further agony after reports the youngster had been found safe and well proved false. Kamille 'Cupcake' McKinney was...
